person.persName: Theodore Schwartz (Jefferson County, Kentucky, banker and foreign consul)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, banker, and foreign consul. Native of Hanover. Married to Henrietta Gunter Schwartz in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on May 30, 1846. Married to Anna Amelia Beason Trout Schwartz in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on July 26, 1853. Father of Theodore C. Schwartz, George Schwartz, Lina Schwartz, Anna Schwartz, and Emma E. Schwartz. Banker in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Jefferson County in 1860. Banking partner with John Smidt in John Smidt & Company in Louisville in 1861 through 1862. Consul for the German states in Louisville in 1861. Partner with John Smidt in John Smidt & Company, European Bank and Exchange, in Louisville in 1864. Consul for Bavaria, Hanover, and Oldenburg in Louisville in 1864 and 1865. Treasurer of the Ohio and Kentucky Petroleum and Mining Company in Louisville in 1865.
